description: Asia's musical landscape is incredibly diverse, with ancient and sophisticated classical systems, a wide array of folk traditions, and vibrant popular music scenes.

regions.name: East Asia
regions.description: Features highly developed court music traditions, distinct scales (like the pentatonic scale), and unique theatrical forms.

regions.name: South Asia
regions.description: Dominated by two major classical systems: Hindustani (North India, Pakistan, Bangladesh) and Carnatic (South India). Music is based on melodic frameworks (ragas) and rhythmic cycles (talas).

regions.name: Southeast Asia
regions.description: Characterized by large percussion ensembles, especially metallophone orchestras like the Gamelan. Vocal music often features unique singing styles.

regions.name: Central Asia
regions.description: Music of the Turkic and Persian peoples of the Silk Road region, often featuring epic storytelling by bards accompanied by string instruments.

regions.name: Middle East (West Asia)
regions.description: Rooted in Arabic, Persian, and Turkish classical traditions. It is characterized by melodic modes (maqamat) and rhythmic patterns (iqa'at).
